answers.answer: I bet you are fine.  I'm almost 200 lbs now and I was worried that I would have GD because of so much weight gain and the fact that regular diabeties runs in my family. But no I was fine.She was probably just going over it with you.  I'm sure she doesnt suspect anything.  Its hard to know who will and who wont have it but, if your as cautious as you seem, I bet your ok. :-)Good luck and let us know how it went.

It's not entirely random who get GD but if you google risk factors for GD, you'll see that there are people who are more prone to getting GD. For instance, age, weight, family history and ethnicity are just a few of the factors that put some women at higher risk of getting GD than others. I was insulin dependant with my last baby and as soon as I delivered, my sugars went back to normal. Good luck and don't stress. There's nothing you can do.

One thing a nurse told me to do is try and be very careful about your carb intake the day before the test.  It will give you a more accurate test.  I had for my 1st pg but not for my 2nd--and soon as I delivered my sugar was fine and is still fine to this day this is 4 years later.  A lot of times if you are diabetic with pg--a balanced diet will control it for you--but yes don't stress if you have it you have it and nothing can be done--you will have3 the one hour test done first and then if your don't pass they will have you go to the lab and do a three hour glucose test and see if you have it then.

Thank you all for your advice and input.  I really do worry about everything, so every time I have to do a std test, I begin to freak out about two weeks before.  I know it's not good for baby boy, but I can't help it!  I want him (and me) to be just fine.  Love to you all!  I'll let everyone know once I have it.

question: Hi all: In a week 1/2, I have the std GD test (I'll be about 26w4days).  My OB said there's really nothing I can do to prevent getting GD, so to relax, take the test and let the results dictate what we do next, but I think she's just trying to say it's too late for me to do anything about it now if I end of having it.  I don't know why I would have it, because I have no idea what causes it - she only explained what it is.  I am a small-framed person, but I've gained significant weight so far in this pg (significant to me - apparently not to anyone else-though when I compare myself to others, I sound like a heifer).  Anyway, my OB said that she's seen small, healthy people who exercise all the time have GD, so it's a tad unexplained beyond genetics why people get GD.  Can anyone out there let me know what they know on GD?  I'm nervous about having it.  I haven't exercised really much this pg (way too tired before and after work), I eat OK (sometimes not the highest of nutrition value foods, but my OB said that's ok, too), and I'm just a little worrried about it.  I worry about everything!!!  Thanks!
title: Gestational Diabetes test coming up - lots of questions
